category: Member Sports Organization Regulations/Article 26 (Disqualification of Executives)
contents: Article 26 (Disqualifications for Executives) ① Any person who falls under any of the following items cannot become an executive of a member sports organization. Revised 2017. 8. 7., 2018. 10. 4., 2019. 5. 29., 2020. 10. 16., 2021. 10. 6. 1. Persons who are not citizens of the Republic of Korea (limited to the chairman) 2 A person who falls under any subparagraph of Article 33 of the National Public Officials Act 3. Deleted 2019. 5. 29. 4. Deleted 2019. 5. 29. 5. Deleted 2019. 5. 29. 6. Deleted 2019. 5. 29. 7. Deleted 2019. 5. 29. 8. In relation to duties during the period of employment at sports organizations and city/provincial/city/county/district sports organizations specified in items (a) through (c) of Article 2, Paragraph 9 of the National Sports Promotion Act. A person who has committed a crime prescribed in Articles 355 and 356 of the Criminal Act and has been sentenced to a fine of 3 million won or more and whose sentence has been confirmed (including persons whose sentence has lapsed). Amended on October 6, 2021 2022. 12. 26. 9. Competitions that affect the results of games hosted and managed by sports organizations and city/provincial/city/county/district sports organizations specified in items (a) through (c) of Article 2, Paragraph 9 of the National Sports Promotion Act. A person who participates in manipulation and commits a crime stipulated in Article 314 of the Criminal Act and Articles 47 and 48 of the National Sports Promotion Act and is sentenced to a fine or greater and the sentence is confirmed. Amended on October 6, 2021 2. A person who has committed a crime falling under any of the following items and has been sentenced to imprisonment or heavier punishment and the execution of the sentence is completed (including cases where the execution is deemed to have been completed), or the date the execution is exempted or the sentence of imprisonment or heavier punishment is completed. A person for whom 20 years have not passed since the date of being sentenced to probation or for whom 10 years have not passed since the date on which the fine was confirmed. Newly established on December 26, 2022. A sexual crime pursuant to Article 2 of the Special Act on the Punishment of Sexual Violence Crimes. 9-3 of sexual crimes against children and adolescents under Article 2, Paragraph 2 of the Act on the Protection of Children and Adolescents from Sex. A person who has committed a crime of injury or assault against an athlete, Chapter 25 of Part 2 of the Criminal Act, has been sentenced to imprisonment without prison labor or a heavier sentence, and the execution of the sentence is completed (including cases where the execution is deemed to have been completed), or the date the execution is exempted; or A person for whom 10 years have not passed since the date of being sentenced to a suspended sentence of imprisonment without prison labor or heavier punishment ​ Newly established December 26, 10, 2022 Sports organizations and cities/provinces/municipalities/subparagraphs 9 (a) to (c) of Article 2 of the National Sports Promotion Act A person who falls under any of the following items in a county/district sports organization. Amended on October 6, 2021. A person who has been subject to disciplinary action higher than suspension of qualifications for sexual misconduct, such as violence or sexual assault. A person who has been subject to disciplinary action of more than one year of suspension for match-fixing, biased decisions, embezzlement, or breach of trust. A person who has received a disciplinary action higher than suspension of qualifications and the period has not expired 11. National Assembly member, head of local government, local council member Revised 2021. 10. 6. 12. Disqualification of executive despite social controversy and no disciplinary action from the Sports Council and Sports Council-related organizations 13. A person who was an executive of a member organization (member sports organization, city/provincial sports association) at the time the Board of Directors of the Sports Association designated a member organization (member sports organization, city/provincial sports association) as a management organization, 5 years from the date of designation Persons who have not passed this period (including those who were executives up to 6 months prior to the date of designation) ​Amended on October 6, 2021, December 26, 2022 ② Relatives of the Chairman (referring to relatives under Article 777 of the Civil Act) may become executives. does not exist. ③ Executives and employees of businesses that have a business relationship with a member organization cannot become executives of the member organization. However, if the member sport organization wishes to appoint the relevant person as an executive according to the needs of the member sport organization, the member sport organization may appoint the person at the general meeting after submitting a pledge from the relevant person not to engage in illegal or unfair transactions with the member sport organization. In this case, if an objection is raised regarding illegality or unfairness in the transaction relationship between the relevant executive and the member sports organization, the Sports Association may investigate ex officio and dismiss the executive in question based on the results. ④ Executives must submit a pledge stating that they do not fall under the provisions of paragraphs 1 to 3, and if the pledge is untrue after submission, they will be immediately dismissed and cannot be permanently appointed as an executive. [Fully revised on March 23, 2017. .]
